faqs.q: Can pros integrate with existing builder closets?
faqs.a: Yes. Specialists typically demo builder-grade wire systems, patch/paint as needed, and install custom millwork that maximizes the existing footprint.
Most reaches-in and standard walk-in closets are installed in a single day. Larger projects like garages or whole-home systems may take 2-3 days.

Many professionals offer eco-friendly material options including NAF (No Added Formaldehyde) boards, FSC-certified wood, water-based low-VOC finishes, and recycled-content materials. Discuss these options with your chosen provider. Sustainable materials typically add 15-20% to project costs.

faqs.q: Do sustainable materials look different from standard options?
faqs.a: No, sustainable materials look and feel just as premium as standard high-end finishes. The difference is in improved air quality and eco-friendly sourcing rather than appearance.

faqs.q: Can sustainable materials contribute to LEED certification?
faqs.a: Yes, many sustainable material options available from professionals can contribute points toward LEED certification for home remodels. Discuss your green building goals with your chosen provider.

faqs.q: Do I need to empty my closet before installation?
faqs.a: Yes, the space needs to be clear. If you need assistance, we can connect you with professional organizers who can help purge and pack.
Yes, we can arrange design-only engagements with annotated plans and material lists if you already have a preferred contractor.
